    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
            "Comment.": represents the real-time noisy commentary from the commentator as the game progresses.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Bayern Munich clinched a dramatic 3-2 victory over Barcelona in a pulsating Champions League semi-final, yet their gallant effort fell short, as Barcelona's early advantage set the stage for their path to the final.

The first half commenced with a sense of expectation and anxiousness. Barcelona had a remarkable record, scoring in every previous game this European Cup season, and early signs showed neither side willing to concede ground easily. Bayern Munich's tactical plan was evident; caution was the word of the day as they aimed to prevent Barcelona from gaining an early upper hand. Within the first minute, Thomas M√ºller‚Äôs robust challenge marked the match's opening skirmish, signifying Bayern‚Äôs intention to keep Barcelona under pressure.

By the 14th minute, there was a notable shift in energy. Bayern‚Äôs midfield strategists, Alonso and Thiago, began operating deeper, while Lahm resumed his familiar role on the right wing, orchestrating attacks alongside Schweinsteiger who occupied the center. Barcelona responded assertively; Lionel Messi quickly won his first duel against Bernhard, displaying his readiness for the battle.

Bayern embraced the strategy of keeping Barcelona‚Äôs front trio‚ÄîMessi, Neymar, and Suarez‚Äîin check. The emphasis was on a solid four-man defense with Rafinha and Bernat as the offensive safeguards on the outside. The Bayern midfield, with Alonso orchestrating from the center and Schweinsteiger and Thiago rotating roles, attempted to stymie Barcelona's playmakers constantly.

The breakthrough came in the 7th minute from an unlikely source. Medi Benatia surged forward, breaking free to head a corner kick beyond Barcelona‚Äôs goalkeeper Ter Stegen. This early goal ignited the Bavarian crowd and marked Bayern‚Äôs first goal in over six hours of play, putting an end to a frustrating scoring drought since Lewandowski's goal in April against Dortmund. The goal lifted spirits within the Munich stadium, reviving hope among the 67,000-strong Bavarian majority amidst the 70,000 attendees.

However, Barcelona's response was swift and decisive. By the 15th minute, Lionel Messi, Suarez, and Neymar began their assault. Their lethal coordination quickly paid off. In the 27th minute, Suarez‚Äôs incisive run and precise pass fooled the Bayern defense, allowing Neymar to calmly slot in the equalizer. Neuer‚Äôs almost ritualistic raising of his arm signaling offside proved futile as the replay confirmed the legitimacy of the goal, evening the score 1-1. The famed trident of Messi, Suarez, and Neymar continued their domination; it was Messi who again found Suarez, who provided another assist to Neymar, making it 2-1 in favor of Barcelona. Precise passing and situational awareness turned the tide firmly against Bayern.

Barcelona‚Äôs trio did not stop there‚Äîthey struck once more. With Bayern‚Äôs defense cracking under relentless pressure, the 3-1 scoreline in the 32nd minute underscored Barcelona‚Äôs attacking prowess. Neymar‚Äôs continuation of his remarkable scoring streak, seven games in a row, highlighted his form and the impactful synergy of Barcelona's front trio.

Despite the setback, Bayern remained resilient. They attempted to claw back into the game when Lewandowski, in the 28th minute, pushed forward valiantly against a wall of Barcelona players, demonstrating the unyielding spirit despite the mounting odds. Unfortunately, Bayern's defense found it challenging to contain the seamless Barcelona transitions, relying heavily on Neuer‚Äôs heroics to keep the scoreline from becoming more lopsided.

Entering the second half with a 1-2 deficit and 45 minutes to salvage their Champions League dreams, Bayern Munich knew the uphill battle that lay ahead. M√ºller displayed his combative side, indulging in minor frictions with Jordi Alba. The final part of the season saw Bayern conceding 22 goals, a glaring vulnerability Barcelona was keen to exploit further.

With injuries cruelly hampering Bayern‚Äôs squad, the lack of freshness and match fitness for returnees like Lahm, Thiago, and Schweinsteiger was stark. Suarez‚Äôs substitution hinted at Barcelona‚Äôs depth and their comfort in managing the game‚Äôs tempo. Long passes, diagonal runs, and tactical switches evidenced Bayern‚Äôs strategic attempts to breach Barcelona‚Äôs solid setup.

The Bavarian record of reaching four consecutive semi-finals deserves acknowledgment. Still, it also exposed the recurring Spanish hurdle‚Äîboth Real Madrid and now Barcelona proved formidable adversaries. Bayern sought a respectful exit and aimed not just to avoid embarrassment but possibly to snatch a win to end their season honorably. There was always a risk in pushing aggressively for an equalizer, risking further Barcelona goals, given their devastating counter-attacks.

Surprisingly, it was Bayern who started to show life again in the second half. A well-timed pass from Schweinsteiger found Lewandowski, who, despite his physical limitations, maintained his scoring touch and netted a delightful goal in the 57th minute, making the score 2-2. This goal reinvigorated the team and their fans, bringing a spark of hope and lifting spirits amidst a challenging match.

Barcelona‚Äôs strategic conservatism now appeared. They aimed to maintain control, relying on positional play and controlling the ball rather than pushing aggressively. Bayern‚Äôs off-the-ball efforts increased, and their aerial supremacy became notable. Meanwhile, Barcelona introduced veteran Xavi, giving him his 150th Champions League appearance, ensuring their midfield retained a calming presence.

The fans, sensing Bayern‚Äôs growing courage, roared their support. Thomas M√ºller, the evergreen talisman of Bayern, exemplified their revival. Receiving a precise ball from Schweinsteiger in the 73rd minute, M√ºller capitalized on the space granted, deftly slotting the ball past Ter Stegen, bringing the game to 3-2. This goal ignited the Allianz Arena, with the atmosphere electric as Bayern inched closer to an improbable comeback.

The game‚Äôs final quarter was a cauldron of emotions and near-misses. Guardiola, now suit-less and animated by the touchline, urged his team forward. Substitute introductions like Mario G√∂tze and Javi Mart√≠nez energized Bayern further, indicating a last-ditch effort to find the net multiple times. Bayern‚Äôs persistent endeavors in attack created critical moments, sometimes staved off by Ter Stegen's brilliant goalkeeping or untimely defensive errors.

Barcelona, meanwhile, executed tactical time-consuming plays, drawing fouls and mellowing the game‚Äôs pace. Despite an intense push, Bayern's defensive frailties emerged, and Barcelona wisely managed the remaining minutes to safeguard their aggregate lead.

Ultimately, the final whistle reflected a victorious yet bittersweet end for Bayern Munich. They succeeded in winning the battle 3-2 but fell short in the larger war, the aggregate deficit insurmountable after the first-leg disasters. As the match concluded, the entire arena recognized the efforts and resilience displayed by both teams.

Barcelona‚Äôs tactical brilliance and clinical finishing epitomized their journey to the final and highlighted their offensive trio‚Äôs lethal effectiveness. Bayern Munich, with their proud heads held high, left the Champions League exhibiting fight, heart, and moments of sheer skill, despite not achieving their ultimate objective.

The game will be remembered not only for its scoreline but for its encapsulation of football‚Äôs unpredictable drama, full of tactical intricacies, individual brilliance, and sheer determination‚Äîqualities epitomized by both these historic clubs. The fans, leaving the stadium, were witnesses to a thrilling chapter of Champions League lore, eagerly awaiting to see Barcelona's heroes continue their quest for European glory.
